sen.j: 1132年（長承元年）以前に威儀師となり、1165年（永万元年）の役務停止となるまで東大寺が所有する荘園の拡大や東大寺の再興に功績を上げた。
sen.e: He became a priest prior to 1132, and between then and his retirement in 1165 he expanded the grounds of Todaiji and reinvigorated Todaiji Temple.

sen.j: 伊賀国黒田荘や大和国高殿荘をめぐり、目代（もくだい）や興福寺西金堂衆などと争ったが、僧綱を背景にした政治力と流暢な弁舌で有利に決着させ、相手側から「南京の悪僧」とまでいわれた。
sen.e: Regarding the Kuroda-no-sho estates in Iga-no-kuni and Koden-sho in Yamato-no-kuni, there were disputes with agents and priests in the 'seisando' or image hall west of Kofukuji Temple however with the political strength of the priest administrators and his eloquent speech he won the upper hand and his opponents called him the 'wayward priest of the southern capital.'

sen.e: Regarding the Kuroda-no-sho estates in Iga-no-kuni and Koden-sho in Yamato-no-kuni, there were disputes with agents and priests in the 'seisando' or image hall west of Kofukuji Temple however with the political strength of the priest administrators and his eloquent speech he won the upper hand and his opponents called him the 'wayward priest of the southern capital.'

Regarding the Kuroda-no-sho estates in Iga Province and Koden-sho in Yamato Province, there were disputes with agents and priests in the Saikon-do Hall (An image hall situated to the west of a pagoda in temple grounds) however with the political strength of the priest administrators and his eloquent speech he won the upper hand and his opponents called him the 'wayward priest of the southern capital.'

sen.j: 自らも大和国清澄荘の田を東大寺に寄進し、1127年（大治2年）東寺が炎上した際には「十二天画像」や「五大尊画像」などを修理している。
sen.e: He himself donated fields of Kiyosumi-no-sho in Yamato-no-kuni to Todaiji Temple, and after a fire at the temple in 1127, he repaired the 'Juniten Images' ('Image of Twelve Divas') and the 'Godaison Images' ('Five Buddhist Deities).
